channel.title: Mouse and Math questions
channel.description:
Two questions: 1. Do the mouse functions (MMouse, MoveMouse,...) move the mouse along curves/arcs, or are they just random line segments?
2. Is there any int() function, to convert an extended variable to an integer?
Thanks.

item.title: Mouse and Math questions
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

It does, but I haven’t used those in math yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse and Math questions
item.dc:creator: @benland100 benland100
item.description:
@benland100 wrote:

Cheesehunk:

Look at MakeMouseSpinePath, and MMouse to understand how it works. It is very complicated, the guy who made it (BenLand100) is a math genius, and it is very hard to understand how it works.

Damn straight
(uber bump please?)

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse and Math questions
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

xxlegitxx:

Thanks, I know what MoveMouse and MMouse are, I’m just wondering how they work, how do splines work? Where do I find the procedure for MMouse? I’m looking in all the SRL includes, and I cant seem to find it.

Look in SRL/SRL/core/MouseFlag.scar

Look at MakeMouseSpinePath, and MMouse to understand how it works. It is very complicated, the guy who made it (BenLand100) is a math genius, and it is very hard to understand how it works.

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:3, topic:15207”]EDIT: I also see a lot of people put this:

{.include SRL/SRL.scar}
{.include SRL/SRL/Skill/Magic.scar}
{.include SRL/SRL/Skill/Runecrafting.scar}

Is this necessary? Doesnt SRL.scar state:

{.include srl\srl\core\Globals.scar} {.include srl\srl\core\Users.scar} {.include srl\srl\core\Math.scar} {.include srl\srl\misc\Conversions.scar} ... [/quote]

{.include SRL\SRL.scar} only includes the core includes, to save memory. You need to include the extended, skill, and misc includes yourself…

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse and Math questions
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Thanks, I know what MoveMouse and MMouse are, I’m just wondering how they work, how do splines work? Where do I find the procedure for MMouse? I’m looking in all the SRL includes, and I cant seem to find it.

And I found the Int() function. Its Int(). What a surprise…

EDIT: I also see a lot of people put this:

{.include SRL/SRL.scar}
{.include SRL/SRL/Skill/Magic.scar}
{.include SRL/SRL/Skill/Runecrafting.scar}

Is this necessary? Doesnt SRL.scar state:

{.include srl\srl\core\Globals.scar}
{.include srl\srl\core\Users.scar}
{.include srl\srl\core\Math.scar}
{.include srl\srl\misc\Conversions.scar}
...

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse and Math questions
item.dc:creator: @yohojo yohojo
item.description:
@yohojo wrote:

Movemouse is a buit in scar runctino. its very bad!
MMouse moves arroudn “splines” i think and is a very awesomeone procedure
Mouse(x,y,rx,ry,true) is alsog ood
It moves mouse to cords and clikcs

Yes there is an int functinon to do that but i dont rember it right now.
I used it in my woodcutter progres preport ill try to find it altter for you

Hers an example from scar help

program PrintNumbers;
var i: Integer;
e: Extended;
begin
i:= 10;
e:= 3.5;
Writeln(‘i=’ + IntToStr(i) + ‘, e=’ + FloatToStr(e));
end.

ill make it simpler

program PrintNumbers;
e: Extended;
begin
e:= 3.5;
Writeln(FloatToStr(e));
end.

This woould write 3.5

It doesnt convert it to an integer but it writes it.
Extenders always ahve a . (point) so they are not even integers… =)

Read full topic
